summary.para: The GetVolumeRangeChannel method gets the volume range for a specified channel.

param.name: iChannel
param.para: The channel number for which to get the volume range. If the audio stream has n channels, the channels are numbered from 0 to n– 1. To obtain the number of channels in the stream, call the method.

param.name: pflVolumeMindB
param.para: Receives the minimum volume level for the channel, in decibels.

param.name: pflVolumeMaxdB
param.para: Receives the maximum volume level for the channel, in decibels.

param.name: pflVolumeIncrementdB
param.para: Receives the volume increment for the channel, in decibels.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

description.para: Parameter pfLevelMinDB, pfLevelMaxDB, or pfVolumeIncrementDB is NULL.

summary.para: The IAudioEndpointVolumeEx interface provides volume controls on the audio stream to or from a device endpoint.
A client obtains a reference to the IAudioEndpointVolumeEx interface of an endpoint device by calling the method with parameter iid set to REFIID IID_IAudioEndpointVolumeEx.
